note.p: Education: Jesus College, Oxford. BA (1788), MA (1791), BD and DD (1812), DD (1835, Cambridge, admitted)

Career: Very poor, but earned a living as tutor; Rector of Somerton, Suffolk (1799); Rector of Hartest with Boxted, Suffolk (1819); Rector of Stansfield (1820); Canon of Ely; Chaplain in ordinary to the Queen (1830-1853)
Notes: Possible birth date of 1766. Foster has Stansted, not Stansfield; 'B E Ely' is Bowyer Edward Sparke, Bishop of Ely
